001package imagingbook.pluginutils;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.io.PrintStream;
007import java.nio.file.Files;
008import java.nio.file.Path;
009import java.time.LocalDateTime;
010import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.List;
013import java.util.stream.Stream;
014
015import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
016import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
017import imagingbook.lib.util.FileUtils;
018import imagingbook.pluginutils.annotations.IjMenuEntry;
019import imagingbook.pluginutils.annotations.IjMenuPath;
020
021/**
022 * The {@code main()} method of this class creates the 'plugins.config' file 
023 * for a plugins project, which is to be included in the associated JAR file.
024 * The execution is to be triggered during the Maven build or manually by
025 * <pre>
026 * mvn exec:java -Dexec.mainClass="imagingbook.pluginutils.PluginsConfigBuilder"</pre>
027 * <p>
028 * (at the root of a plugins project).
029 * The format of the entries in 'plugins.config' have the following structure:
030 * </p>
031 * <pre>
032 * Plugins, "Plugin Name", package.classname
033 * Plugins&gt;Level1&gt;Level2, "Plugin Name", package.classname</pre>
034 * <p>Note that, technically, menu paths may be more than 2 levels deep, but this 
035 * does not seem useful.
036 * </p>
037 * <p>
038 * Plugin classes (implementing {@link PlugIn} or {@link PlugInFilter}) may be annotated
039 * with {@link IjMenuPath} and {@link IjMenuEntry} to specify where in ImageJ's menu tree
040 * and by which name the plugin should be installed.
041 * This information is stored in the 'plugins.config' file at the root of the associated project,
042 * which is automatically added to the project's output JAR file during the Maven build.
043 * Example:
044 * </p>
045 * <pre>
046 * import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
047 * import imagingbook.pluginutils.annotations.IjMenuEntry;
048 * import imagingbook.pluginutils.annotations.IjMenuPath;
049 * ...
050 * {@literal @}IjMenuPath("Plugins&gt;Mine")
051 * {@literal @}IjMenuEntry("Super Plugin")
052 * public class MySuperPlugin implements PlugInFilter {
053 *      // plugin code ...
054 * }</pre>
055 * <p>
056 * By default (i.e., if no annotations are present), plugins in the default package are installed at the
057 * top-level of 'Plugins' whereas plugins inside a named package are  installed 
058 * in 'Plugins&gt;<em>package-name</em>' (see below).
059 * A {@link IjMenuPath} annotation may also be attached to a whole package
060 * in the associated {@code package-info.java} file. The following
061 * example specifies {@code Plugins>Binary Regions} as the default menu path
062 * for all plugins in package {@code Binary_Regions}:
063 * </p>
064 * <pre>
065 * {@literal @}IjMenuPath("Plugins&gt;Binary Regions")
066 * package Binary_Regions;
067 * import imagingbook.pluginutils.annotations.IjMenuPath;</pre>
068 * <p>
069 * Individual plugins may override the menu path specified for the containing package, as summarized below:
070 * <p>
071 * <strong>Plugin <em>path</em> priority rules:</strong>
072 * </p>
073 * <ol>
074 * <li> value of {@link IjMenuPath} annotation at class level (always overrules if exists),</li>
075 * <li> value of {@link IjMenuPath} annotation at package level (if exists),</li>
076 * <li> 'Plugins&gt;<em>package-name</em>' if the plugin is inside a named package, or</li>
077 * <li> 'Plugins' if the plugin is in the (unnamed) default package.</li>
078 * </ol>
079 * <p>
080 * <strong>Plugin <em>entry</em> priority rules:</strong>
081 * </p>
082 * <ol>
083 * <li> value of {@link IjMenuEntry} annotation at class level (if exists),</li>
084 * <li> simple name of the plugin class</li>
085 * </ol>
086 * <p>
087 * Note that, in general, the information in 'plugins.config' is only used when plugins are loaded from 
088 * a JAR file!
089 * </p>
090 * 
091 * 
092 * 
093 * @author WB
094 *
095 */
096public class PluginsConfigBuilder {
097        
098        static String DefaultMenuPath = "Plugins";
099        static String ConfigFileName = "plugins.config";
100        static String INFO = "[INFO] ";
101        
102        static boolean VERBOSE = true;
103        static boolean ReplaceUndescoresInClassNames = true;
104        static boolean ReplaceUndescoresInPackageNames = true;
105        
106        
107        private final String artifactId;
108        private final String rootPath;
109        
110        private PluginsConfigBuilder(String rootName, String artifactId) {
111                this.artifactId = artifactId;           
112                File rootDir = (rootName != null) ?
113                                new File(rootName) :
114                                new File(PluginsConfigBuilder.class.getClassLoader().getResource("").getFile());                                
115                this.rootPath = rootDir.getAbsolutePath();
116        }
117        
118        private List<Class<?>> collectPluginClasses() {
119                int n = rootPath.length();
120                File rootFile = new File(rootPath);     
121                if (!rootFile.exists()) {       // this happens when executed in a project with POM-packaging
122                        return null;
123                }
124                
125                Path start = rootFile.toPath();
126                List<Class<?>> pluginClasses = new ArrayList<>();
127                
128                try (final Stream<Path> allPaths = Files.walk(start)) {
129                        allPaths.filter(Files::isRegularFile).forEach(path -> {
130                                String pathName = path.toString();
131                                if (FileUtils.getFileExtension(pathName).equals("class")) {
132                                        String className = FileUtils.stripFileExtension(pathName);
133                                        // remove non-class part of filename:
134                                        className = className.substring(n + 1);
135                                        // convert to qualified class name:
136                                        className = className.replace(File.separatorChar, '.');
137                                        // find the associated class object (this should never fail):
138                                        Class<?> clazz = null;
139                                        try {
140                                                clazz = Class.forName(className);
141                                        } catch (final ClassNotFoundException e) {
142                                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
143                                        }
144
145                                        if (clazz != null && isIjPlugin(clazz)) {
146                                                pluginClasses.add(clazz);
147                                        }
148                                }
149                        });
150                } catch (IOException e) {
151                        //throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
152                        System.out.println("SOMETHING BAD HAPPENED: " + e.getMessage());
153                }
154                return pluginClasses;
155        }
156        
157        /**
158         * Writes plugin configuration entries to the specified stream.
159         * 
160         * @param pluginClasses a list of plugin classes
161         * @param strm the output stream (e.g., System.out)
162         */
163        private void writeEntriesToStream(List<Class<?>> pluginClasses, PrintStream strm) {
164                DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss");
165                strm.println("# plugins.config file for " + artifactId + " (automatically generated)");
166                strm.println("# number of plugins: " + pluginClasses.size());
167                strm.println("# date: " + LocalDateTime.now().format(formatter));
168                
169                for (Class<?> clazz : pluginClasses) {
170                        // configure menu path:
171                        Package pkg = clazz.getPackage();
172                        String menuPath = DefaultMenuPath;
173                        if (pkg != null) {
174                                // see if 'package-info.java' contains specifies a menu path for this package
175                                // TODO: warn if package nesting is deeper than 1
176                                IjMenuPath packageMenuPathAnn = pkg.getDeclaredAnnotation(IjMenuPath.class);
177                                String pkgName = (ReplaceUndescoresInPackageNames) ? 
178                                                pkg.getName().replace('_', ' ') : pkg.getName();
179                                menuPath = (packageMenuPathAnn != null) ? 
180                                                packageMenuPathAnn.value() : DefaultMenuPath + ">" + pkgName;
181                        }
182                        // see if clazz specifies a menu path for this package (overrules package specification)
183                        IjMenuPath classMenuPathAnn = clazz.getDeclaredAnnotation(IjMenuPath.class);
184                        if (classMenuPathAnn != null) {
185                                menuPath = classMenuPathAnn.value();    
186                        }
187                        
188                        // configure menu entry:
189                        IjMenuEntry classMenuEntryAnn = clazz.getDeclaredAnnotation(IjMenuEntry.class);
190                        String className = (ReplaceUndescoresInClassNames) ?
191                                        clazz.getSimpleName().replace('_', ' ') : clazz.getSimpleName();
192                        String menuEntry = (classMenuEntryAnn != null) ? classMenuEntryAnn.value() : className;
193                        // build line for entry in config file:
194                        String configLine = String.format("%s, \"%s\", %s", menuPath, menuEntry, clazz.getCanonicalName());
195                        if (VERBOSE)
196                                System.out.println(INFO + "*** " + configLine);
197                        
198//                      strm.format("%s, \"%s\", %s\n", menuPath, menuEntry, clazz.getCanonicalName());
199                        strm.println(configLine);
200                }
201        }
202        
203        private String buildfile() {
204                List<Class<?>> pluginClasses = collectPluginClasses();
205                if  (pluginClasses == null) {
206                        System.out.println(INFO + "WARNING: no target directory (POM project?)");
207                        return null;
208                }
209                if  (pluginClasses.isEmpty()) {
210                        System.out.println(INFO + "WARNING: no plugin classes found!");
211                        return null;
212                }
213                System.out.println(INFO + "Number of plugins: " + pluginClasses.size());
214//              writeEntriesToStream(pluginClasses, System.out);
215                
216                File configFile = new File(rootPath + "/" + ConfigFileName);
217//              System.out.println("configPath = " + configFile.getAbsolutePath());
218                
219                try (PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(configFile)) {
220                        writeEntriesToStream(pluginClasses, ps);
221                } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
222                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
223                }
224                
225                return configFile.getAbsolutePath();
226        }
227        
228        /**
229         * Returns true if the specified {@link Class} object is a sub-type of
230         * {@link PlugIn} or {@link PlugInFilter}.
231         * 
232         * @param clazz a {@link Class} object
233         * @return true if a plugin type
234         */
235        private boolean isIjPlugin(Class<?> clazz) {
236                return PlugIn.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz) || PlugInFilter.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz);
237        }
238        
239        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
240        
241        /**
242         * Argument 1: project build root directory 
243         * Argument 2: project artefact id 
244         * @param args arguments
245         */
246        public static void main(String[] args) {
247                String rootName   = (args.length > 0) ? args[0] : null;
248                String artifactId = (args.length > 1) ? args[1] : null;
249                System.out.println(INFO);
250                System.out.println(INFO + "--- Building plugins.config file for " + artifactId + " ---");
251                
252                PluginsConfigBuilder builder = new PluginsConfigBuilder(rootName, artifactId);
253                String configPath = builder.buildfile();
254                if (configPath != null) {
255                        System.out.println(INFO + "Config file written: " + configPath);
256                }
257                else {
258                        System.out.println(INFO + "No config file written");
259                }
260        }
261
262}
